question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute
\[\cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7}.\]
inference:
Using the product-to-sum formula, we have
\begin{align*}
\cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{7} + \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{7} - \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} + \cos \left( -\frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \left( \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \left( \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \left( \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - 2 \left( \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 4 \left( \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 4 \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16
ground_truth:
Let $x = \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7}.$  Then by repeated application of the double angle formula,
\begin{align*}
x \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{2} \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{8} \sin \frac{16 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{8} \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7},
\end{align*}so $x = \boxed{\frac{1}{8}}.$

question:
Using the product-to-sum formula, we have
\begin{align*}
\cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} &= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{7} + \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) + \cos \left( \frac{2 \pi}{7} - \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} + \cos \left( -\frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \left( \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \left( \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \left( \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - 2 \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{6 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 2 \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - 2 \left( \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} - \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 4 \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 4 \left( \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16} \left( \cos \frac{14 \pi}{7} + \cos \frac{10 \pi}{7} + 4 \left( \cos \frac{6 \pi}{7} - \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7} \right) \right) \\
&= \frac{1}{16

ground_truth:
Let $x = \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7}.$  Then by repeated application of the double angle formula,
\begin{align*}
x \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} &= \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{2 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{2} \sin \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{4 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{4} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \cos \frac{8 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{8} \sin \frac{16 \pi}{7} \\
&= \frac{1}{8} \sin \frac{2 \pi}{7},
\end{align*}so $x = \boxed{\frac{1}{8}}.$
